title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for ONE correct description of an economic factor.

Two points for TWO correct descriptions of economic factors.
descriptions: The response does not correctly describe one of the following economic factors that have contributed to similarities between the cultural landscapes shown:
The response correctly describes one of the following economic factors that have contributed to similarities between the cultural landscapes shown:
The response correctly describes two of the following economic factors that have contributed to similarities between the cultural landscapes shown:

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that the Internet allows for a diversity of cultural expression, without explicitly linking this concept to cultural divergence.

One point for stating that the Internet allows for a diversity of cultural expression, without explicitly linking this concept to cultural divergence.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following ways how increased Internet access throughout the world is likely to contribute to cultural divergence:
The response correctly states one of the following ways how increased Internet access throughout the world is likely to contribute to cultural divergence:
The response correctly explains one of the following ways how increased Internet access throughout the world is likely to contribute to cultural divergence:

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that the food may change as its influenced by other cultures and/or locations, without explicitly describing the process by which this occurs.

Two points for describing how, through the processes of diffusion,(relocation, stimulus, expansion) culture traits such as food are often modified and take new or modified forms in different locations.
descriptions: The response does not correctly describe one of the following processes by which an ethnic food may be altered as it spreads from its country of origin:
The response correctly states one of the following processes by which an ethnic food may be altered as it spreads from its country of origin:
The response correctly explains one of the following processes by which an ethnic food may be altered as it spreads from its country of origin:

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating the definition of syncretism, without explaining how this process may affect the cultural landscapes of New York and Tokyo.

Two points for explaining how many different cultural traits combine to create new forms of cultural expression that can be seen in the cultural landscapes of New York and Tokyo.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following degrees to which the process of syncretism may affect the cultural landscapes of New York and Tokyo:
The response correctly states one of the following degrees to which the process of syncretism may affect the cultural landscapes of New York and Tokyo:
The response correctly explains one of the following degrees to which the process of syncretism may affect the cultural landscapes of New York and Tokyo:

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that the images provide only a small amount of information regarding population density, without explaining how this limitation relates to population density or environmental effects.

Two points for explaining a limitation of the images in terms of specific geographical factors or features that are not shown in the images.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following limitations of comparing Image 1 and Image 2 to understand how population density affects the environment and natural resources:
The response correctly states one of the following limitations of comparing Image 1 and Image 2 to understand how population density affects the environment and natural resources:
The response correctly explains one of the following limitations of comparing Image 1 and Image 2 to understand how population density affects the environment and natural resources:
